name: Name withheld by police
agency_responsible: "Riverside County Sheriff's Department, Beaumont Police Department, Banning Police Department"
circumstances: Deputies responded to a domestic violence call. Upon arrival, the individual they were looking for was no longer on the scene. Deputies later learned the individual was near I-10. They lovated the individual, and the person reportedly attempted to flee the area by ramming a vehicle into others, including police vehicles. Police shot and killed the individual during this interaction.

name: Roberto Salgado
street_address: E. Mission Ave. and Gamble Street
circumstances: Police spotted the vehicle of an alleged homicide suspect around 11:20 p.m. and attempted to perform a traffic stop. Salgado fled from police in the vehicle, according to the Escondido Police Department. The pursuit ended near Mission Avenue and Gamble Street around 3 a.m. The car, which had OnStar, was disabled through that system, police said. When the truck was stopped, the suspect got out and there was an exchange of gunfire between him and two Escondido police officers.

name: Enrique Ruiz
circumstances: On Sunday, officers arrived in the Eagle Rock neighborhood of Los Angeles at about 6 p.m. following a request for backup from the Los Angeles Fire Department for the man with the knife. The man, whose name has not been released, got out of a parked car when the officers got there. He was allegedly still holding the knife, according to Twitter posts from the LAPD's Media Relations Division. The man allegedly did not follow commands to drop the knife and approached an officer, police said. At least one officer opened fire, striking the man. He was pronounced dead at a hospital.

name: Daniel Elena Lopez
circumstances: Police shot a man who had allegedly began acting erratically, threatening to throw items from the upper floor and attacked a woman with a bicycle lock in a Burlington Coat Factory store crowded with holiday shoppers.

name: Valentina Orellana-Peralta
circumstances: Valentina was shot by LAPD officers while she was in a dressing room. Police say she was a bystander shot while they were shooting at another man in Burlington Coat Factory.

name: Rosendo Olivio
circumstances: According to a report from Officer Norma Eisenman, the officers responding to a domestic violence call shot the man after he failed to follow instructions to drop his weapon. He was also continually advancing of officers when he was shot.

name: Margarito Lopez
circumstances: Police responded to reports of a man threatening to harm himself and others with a knife. Police shot and killed the man.

name: Name withheld by police
circumstances: Police received a 911 call from a store saying a man in the parking lot had a firearm and was taking the magazine out and putting it back in. The clerk then advised the man left in his vehicle, driving recklessly, police said. Responding officers found the man's vehicle traveling westbound on Market Avenue. Officers then conducted a high-risk traffic stop, eventually pulling him over to the side of the road where officers began to speak with him. During the exchange, officers noticed the man had blood on his hands, and they ordered him to exit his vehicle and put his hands up. The man got out of his car holding a firearm in his right hand and ignored police commands to raise his hands. Four officers shot and killed him.
initial_reason: person wtih a gun (gun was toy)

name: Amanuel Aman Moreno
circumstances: At about 11:30 a.m., deputies responded to a report of a shooting at a Nation's Giant Hamburgers, where an armed man entered and robbed the cashier. An off-duty officer from the UC Berkeley Police Department was dining at the restaurant and confronted Amanuel Moreno. The officer fired one shot, killing Moreno.

name: Cristian Alanzo Anguiano
circumstances: Officers responded to a reported family disturbance at around 8:15 p.m. Officers arrived to find Cristian Alanzo Anguiano in the driveway, refusing to comply with commands. He reentered the residence and forced his way into the bedroom where family members were hiding from him. When officers entered the home, Anguiano was armed with an edged weapon, and police shot and killed him.

name: Guadalupe Zavala
street_address: James Donlon Blvd and Hummingbird Drive
circumstances: Around 1 p.m., officers responded to reports of shots fired near Dove Court. When police arrived, they found a man armed with a rifle, shooting at cars and houses. The man shot down a police drone that was attempting to survey the area. Police said Guadalupe Zavala fired from inside the home in the direction of officers and other residents. After hours of standoff, Zavala reportedly set fire to the inside of the garage. The flames soon engulfed the house, and Zavala came outside where he was confronted by officers, and the officers shot and killed him.

name: Angelo Weitz
circumstances: Police got calls about a man reportedly firing a gun outside the police department's headquarters. Six officers went out to investigate. Police allege an individual came at them screaming and armed with a handgun. The individual did get down on their stomach, but reportedly continued screaming. Police claim the individual stood back up, pointed the gun at them, and began running at them. Five officers shot and killed the individual.
officer_names: Nicole Williams, Nicholas Frayer, Hao Tran, Seth Powell, Ruben Rillon

name: Travers Spargo King
circumstances: Travers Spargo King allegedly tried to drive into the Marine Corps training facility near Lindbergh Field without permission shortly before noon. After allegedly ignoring repeated orders to halt, King got out of his vehicle and belligerently approached depot personnel with a knife in his hand. They shot and killed him.

name: Devin Edward Hall
circumstances: Officers were called about 2:35 p.m., after the suspect allegedly shot Gevork Minissian, 70. Devin Edward Hall allegedly tried to flee from police by jumping into a woman's car and attempting to carjack her. However, the man was unable to steal the car and exchanged gunfire with police before running onto Sunnyslope Avenue. Hall allegedly attempted to carjack a second woman, but again failed to steal the vehicle and held the woman at gunpoint until he was cornered by police. The man exchanged fire with police and was shot and killed.

name: Rodolpho Antonio Ruiz
circumstances: Ruiz reportedly robbed a Circle K before attempting to rob a nearby liquor store. Ruiz ran from the store after the owners pulled their own guns out. Two officers eventually caught up to Ruiz and reportedly tried to get him to drop a gun. Police claim Ruiz refused to drop the weapon, and police shot and killed him.

name: Joseph Burciaga
circumstances: U.S. Marshals were attempting to serve an arrest warrant. Officers allege the individual ran away from officers and produced a firearm. Officers shot and killed the individual. The officer who shot the individual is a West Covina police officer assigned to the U.S. Marshals  Pacific Southwest Regional Fugitive Task Force.

name: Name withheld by police
circumstances: Police responded to reports of a carjacking. Police later caught up to the suspect and a pursuit began. Police claim the individual tried to ram a patrol vehicle. Police shot and killed the man.

name: Ajmal Amani
circumstances: Police responded to reports of a man armed with a knife. Police shot and killed Amani. Police are withholding all other details about the shooting at this time.
officer_names: John Quinlan (fired gun), Danny De Leon Garcia (fired bean bag weapon)

name: Wendy Carolina Flores De Roque
circumstances: Police responded to reports of a man reportedly lighting items on fire and throwing them at gas pumps. Upon arrival, a deputy reportedly got in a fight with the man. During the fight, a woman reportedly exited a car with a knife. Police allege the woman stabbed the deputy multiple times. The deputy shot at both individuals, killing the woman.

name: Jordon Pas
circumstances: Police were called after 1 a.m. by residents who reported hearing gunfire. During a 90-second fight, police shocked Jordon Pas at least three times, including twice at close range, killing him.

name: Melkon Michaelidis
circumstances: Police responded to reports of a man with a knife reportedly slashing car tires. Upon arrival, police claim an individual approached them carrying bloody knives. Police reportedly attempted to use less lethal munitions before shooting and killing the individual.

name: Christian Valdez
circumstances: At about 12:29 a.m., after reportedly observing a vehicle code violation, an officer stopped a Chevrolet pickup truck. The driver exited the vehicle, allegedly ignored the officer's commands to stop and fled on foot as the officer attempted to detain him. He refused to comply with the officer's commands and allegedly physically resisted as he returned to the truck. He started the truck and a struggle continued as the officer attempted to arrest him. A second officer arrived to assist as the first officer was struggling to arrest Christian Valadez at the open driver's door. He allegedly began driving away as the first officer was still struggling with him. The first officer broke free from the vehicle, avoiding injury, at which time Valadez allegedly attempted to hit the officers. An officer fired several shots, and the driver was shot and killed. The vehicle continued traveling over a chain link fence and collided into a house. No one was injured inside the home.

name: Michael Edward Nelson Jr.
circumstances: Police found Michael Nelson Jr. inside a stolen vehicle at the Milpitas Square Shopping Center. Nelson initially got out of the vehicle, looked at the officers and re-entered the vehicle. Nelson then began shooting at the officers, who shot and killed him.

name: Russell Leggett
street_address: I-10 and North Indian Canyon Drive
agency_responsible: "Riverside County Sheriff's Department, Palm Springs Police Department"
circumstances: Banning Police pulled over an individual for a traffic stop, and the person reportedly fled. Police pursued the vehicle and claim the individual shot at police throughout the pursuit. The individual eventually stopped the vehicle on an offramp, and police fired at the vehicle. The individual was shot and killed.

name: Carlos Arias
circumstances: Carlos Arias was shot and killed by an officer responding to a report of an assault with a deadly weapon. Arias allegedly was holding family members at knifepoint, and a responding officer shot him. The shooting occurred just before 6 a.m.

name: Isaiah Guevara
circumstances: Deputies were on patrol when they reportedly observed Guevara walking in the middle of the street. Deputies pulled up to speak to Guevara and claim he pulled out a gun. Deputies shot and killed Guevara, they never exited their vehicle.

name: Travis Daniel Carlon
circumstances: Police responded to reports of an assault with a deadly weapon. Carlon reportedly ended up barricading himself in a residence. Police claim Carlon eventually came to the door and pointed a weapon at officers. Police shot and killed Carlon.
officer_names: Mauricio Calderon, Gabriel Molina, Rudy Mendoza

name: Rudy Anderson
circumstances: Rudy Anderson allegedly randomly shot at multiple random victims, attempted a carjacking, and took a person hostage when police shot and killed him inside an apartment.
officer_known_past_shootings: 2 (Luis Valle was one of the officers who killed Rene Herrera and Fernando Cruz on 9/18/18 while working at LA Sheriff's Department)

name: Isaac Louis Soria
circumstances: Isaac Louis Soria had been inside a home for five hours, refusing to come out when deputies arrived at 2 p.m. Deputies were called to the home after neighbors reported that Soria had pointed the rifle at them. Police had spoken to Soria for hours. At 7 p.m., he came out of the home, apparently armed and wearing body armor, and deputies shot and killed him.

name: Name withheld by police
circumstances: Officers were called around 4:20 a.m. to a self-storage facility. Someone at the business reported there was a man on the property who was armed with a knife. Officers arrived and found a man with a machete. Officers tried to arrest the man, but he did not comply, and they tasered him. The man reportedly threatened officers, and two officers shot and killed him.

name: Fidel Bedolla
circumstances: Deputies located a vehicle occupied Bedolla, who was a domestic violence suspect. Police allege Bedolla exited his vehicles with a firearm. Depuites shot and killed Bedolla.
officer_names: Adrian Olmos, Andrew Bassett, Robert Gonzales, Robert Fisher, Nicholas Rocha, Adrian Benavides

name: Jesse Medrano
agency_responsible: "California Highway Patrol, Los Angeles County Sheriff's Office"
circumstances: Police went to investigate a disabled minivan on the freeway. Police claim an individual exited the vehicle holding a gun. Police allege the individual shot towards officers. Police shot and killed the person.

name: Christopher Mosco
circumstances: Deputies responded to complaints that a man was acting erratically and suicidal. Christopher Mosco allegedly pointed a long gun at deputies, and the deputies shot and killed him.

name: Brandon Lopez
street_address: N. Bristol St. and W. Santa Ana Blvd.
circumstances: Police observed Lopez, reportedly wanted for armed robberies, driving a stolen vehicle. Police attempted a traffic stop and Lopez allegedly fled, beginning a pursuit. Police ended the pursuit, and a helicopter continued to monitor where Lopez was going. Hel eventually stopped driving, and police attempted to get Lopezl to surrender. During the standoff, Lopez's family members arrived and communicated with police that Lopez was having a mental health crisis. Santa Ana Police Officers arrested members of the family and other bystanders who were objecting the police's actions. A SWAT team deployed chemical weapons to get Lopez to comply. Lopez exited the vehicle and police shot and killed him.
initial_reason: armed robbery, mental health crisis, stolen vehicle, traffic stop
officer_names: Catalin Panov, Kenneth Weber, Paul Delgado, Brett Heitmann

name: Leo Tony Chavez
street_address: N. Indiana Street and Medford Street
circumstances: Following a two-car accident at 3:16 p.m., Leo Chavez got out of his car and exchanged words with the other driver. When CHP arrived, the situation escalated, and the officers attempted to use a stun gun on Chavez. When the attempt failed, Chavez allegedly moved toward the officers and at least one officer shot and killed him.

name: Name withheld by police
circumstances: California Highway Patrol officers responded to reports of a car-crash. Upon arrival, police shot and killed one of the individuals involved. There are no other details available at this time.

name: Manuela Rodriguez
circumstances: A school resource officer was responding to an alleged fight between Rodriguez and a 15 year old girl. Rodriguez reportedly attempted to flee the scene in a car, and the officer opened fire, hitting Rodriguez. Rodriguez later passed in the hospital.

name: Sandra Barajas
circumstances: Police responded to reports of a verbal disturbance. Upon arrival, an officer reportedly saw Barajas make threatening motions toward a girl. The officer apparently attempted to get Barajas to drop the weapon and she reportedly refused. The officer shot and killed her.

name: Ronnie Andrew Garcia
circumstances: Police responded to reports of a man with a gun. Upon arrival, they reportedly attempted to get Garcia to comply. Police allege Garcia was not cooperative, and police shot and killed him.

name: Name withheld by police
street_address: Laguna Park Drive and Seasons Drive
circumstances: Police were called by the Cosumnes Fire Department around 1 p.m. Arriving officers found fire personnel with a man who was acting erratically next to vehicle stopped in the roadway. Police said efforts to detain the man eventually led to resistance and to a struggle between him and officers. Officers restrained the man with handcuffs. Police said the man intentionally hit his head on the concrete, while he was handcuffed and seated. He was taken to the hospital, where around 2:45 p.m., he died.

name: Barry Ross
street_address: West Avenue B and Sierra Highway
circumstances: Police responded to reports of a man brandishing a firearm and pointing it at vehicles and people in a park. A sheriff's helicopter spotted the man, who reportedly got into a vehicle and drove off. Deputies claim the man pointed a firearm at the helicopter and approachig deputies. Deputies shot and killed the individual.

name: Phillip Lopez
circumstances: Police responded to reports of a stabbing at a store. Officers caught up to Lopez, and attempted to take Lopez into custody. Lopez reportedly continued to move on foot. At one point, officers claim Lopez pulled out a large knife. An officer shot and killed Lopez.

name: Jonathan Carroll
street_address: Bear Valley Parkway and Encino Drive
circumstances: Carroll reportedly wounded a motorist in a random car-to-car shooting. Police eventually caught up to Carroll in his vehicle and attempted to pull him over. Carroll led the police on a pursuit until he crashed his car. Police claim Carroll exited the vehicle with a gun in his hand. Officer Chandler Hoppal shot and killed Carroll.

name: Michael Jonathan Cortez
circumstances: An FBI agent deputized as a U.S. Marshal was attempting to serve federal and state arrest warrants on Michael Jonathan Cortez. Surveillance video showed the agent pull up to a store and run around his vehicle with his weapon drawn. The video does not show what happened inside the store. The agent reportedly went to the door, gave unspecified orders, and Cortez tried to run out of the store, bumping into the agent. The agent pushed him back. Cortez allegedly drew a handgun, and the agent shot and killed him.

name: Charles David Chivrell
circumstances: At approximately 10:47 a.m., the California Highway Patrol received a 911 call regarding a suspicious man walking in the roadway with a firearm. The description given to dispatchers was a white man in his early 30s, wearing a leather jacket. Multiple troopers and Arcata Police Department responded and located a male matching this description, walking in the roadway with a firearm. He allegedly brandished a firearm and police shot and killed him. Humboldt County Sheriff William Honsal confirmed that the person killed was not fugitive his agency was seeking.

name: David Lopez
circumstances: Around 2:30 a.m., officers responded to a report of an intoxicated man. The first officer arrived and encountered the suspect, described as a Hispanic male. David Lopez allegedly fired a gun at the officer. The officer shot and killed him.

name: Derek Scott Pearson
circumstances: Officers responding to a welfare check found a man inside a residence with multiple guns. No one else was inside the home. The man barricaded himself in the home and shot at officers several times during an hours-long standoff. An officer shot and killed him.

name: Jorge Calleres
circumstances: Jorge Calleres went inside his ex-girlfriend's house, entered her bedroom, and shot her in the face, critically wounding her. He left his ex-girlfriend's home and stole a car with a mother and her four children inside before releasing them. About an hour and a half after the shooting, Fresno police received calls regarding a man acting erratically near Peach and Butler Avenues. When officers arrived, he appeared to be high on drugs. During the struggle, officers used a taser and three handcuffs to restrain him, and he died a bit later.

name: Cedric Baxter
circumstances: Baxter reportedly fired a gun at a school bus before leading police on a brief chase. Baxter reportedly drove through a fence and crashed into another vehicle. Two officers shot at Baxter, killing him.

name: Robert Nelson
circumstances: Officers responded at about 11:55 a.m. to a residence after receiving a call from a victim who said they had been shot. Arriving officers entered the home and saw an apparent homicide victim before they were confronted by an armed man, Robert Nelson, whom they shot and killed.

name: Albert "AJ" Perez
circumstances: At about 5:30 p.m., Victorville deputies responded to a home near the Victorville City Library. A resident at the home had called 911 saying Albert Perez was in the garage armed with a handgun and causing a disturbance. He was reportedly asked to leave the property but refused. Deputies shot and killed him during a standoff. Details as to what precipitated the killing were withheld by police.

name: Robert Anderson
agency_responsible: "California Highway Patrol, Del Norte County Sheriff's Office"
circumstances: Around 2:45 p.m., officers from the California Highway Patrol and Del Norte County Sheriff's Office responded to a disabled vehicle, which was blocking the road. Upon arrival, the officers discovered a man was walking in the road with a knife. Robert Anderson allegedly advanced toward the officers, and an officer shot and killed him.

name: Kenneth Vessell
circumstances: Police responded to reports of an active shooter at Redondo Beach PIer. Upon arrival, police found two victims who had been shot. Police eventually located a suspect, who they claim was armed with a gun and a knife. When they attempted to take them into custody, police shot and killed them.

name: Kevin Victor Johnson
street_address: Auto Mall Parkway and Southlake Common
circumstances: Police responded to reports of a shooting at a mobile home park. Police later stated that they had shot and killed the suspect about a mile away from the scene.

name: Juan Luis Olvera-Preciado
circumstances: Police were on patrol and reportedly recognized someone with an outstanding felony arrest warrant. An officer then fired his weapon at the individual, for an unknown reason, and instead hit an uninvolved resident sitting in a vehicle. The officer killed Juan Luis Olvera-Preciado.

name: Name withheld by police
circumstances: Police responded to reports that a person had been shot. While investigating, police reportedly encountered an individual in the middle of the street who they allege fired a gun at the officer. The officer shot the individual, killing them.

name: Ervin Olikong
circumstances: A deputy attempted to pull over Olikong for an unknown reason, and Olikong reportedly fled and a chase began. Police claim at one point, Olikong pulled over ahead of the deputy and fired 30+ shots at them. A few days later, deputies attempted to arrest Olikong. Police reportedly exchanged gunfire with Olikong. Deputies shot and killed Olikong.

name: Name withheld by police
circumstances: Police shot and killed a person and withheld almost all information regarding the killing.

name: Name withheld by police
circumstances: Police responded to a call about a disturbance at an apartment complex where a man was screaming and potentially under the influence. Police eventually forced their way into an apartment, and shot and killed the man. There are no other details available at this time.

name: Adrian Joel Sanchez
circumstances: Police stopped a vehicle for an unknown reason and attempted to escort the driver back to a patrol car. The individual reportedly broke free from a deputy and ran up an embankment. The deputy ran after the individual until they returned to the vehicle. An altercation reportedly occurred, after which the individual allegedly drove off, dragging the deputy. The individual crashed the vehicle into multiple fences, and the deputy shot and killed the individual.

name: Rodney Coleman
circumstances: Deputies responded about 9 a.m. to a disturbance at a bus stop. A deputy reportedly handcuffed Rodney Coleman without incident. When the deputy attempted to close the car door, Coleman kicked at the deputy and exited the car. The deputy suffered a minor injury. Emergency responders came and administered aid to the deputy. Coleman reportedly suffered a medical emergency, while medical personnel were helping the deputy. Coleman died.

name: Luis Manuel Garcia
circumstances: A resident summoned police at about 10:05 a.m. When officers arrived, a man emerged from bushes near the entrance of the mobile home park and was allegedly advancing on the officers, when one officer shot and killed him.

name: Che Noe Zuniga
circumstances: Police responded to reports of a domestic argument involving a man reportedly armed with a gun. A few minutes later, police received another call stating shots had been fired and that the shooter had left the scene. Later, police received reports of the suspect at another family member's home. Police attempted to approach Zuniga, and he allegedly led them on a short chase. Police allege they exchanged gunfire with Zuniga, who reportedly dropped a firearm while fleeing the scene on foot. Police claim Zuniga charged at approaching officers, and they shot and killed Zuniga.
officer_names: C. Puryear, S. Mann, J. Pena, C. Dickinson, D. Ramseur

name: Matthew Tran
circumstances: Police had received a call from a road rage victim and instructed the individual to go to a police station. Tran reportedly followed the individual to the police station and entered the station allegedly armed with a handgun. Police shot and killed Tran, it is unclear if Tran ever raised or fired a gun.

name: Dylan Christopher Harmer
circumstances: Police responded to a domestic violence call in which a woman stated her boyfriend had assaulted her and was armed with a handgun. Upon arrival, the man reportedly exited the home, pointed a gun at police, and then fled on foot. Police caught up to the man and claim he was attempting to carjack vehicles. Police claim the man turned and pointed a gun at police, who shot and killed him.

name: Ruben Isaac Sanchez
circumstances: Sanchez was wanted for a murder that occurred on August 1st. Deputies responded to a tip that Sanchez was at a cemetery. Upon arrival, deputies claim Sanchez shot at them. Deputies shot back, killing Sanchez.

name: Hermenegildo Gonzalez Jr.
circumstances: Police responded to reports of someone screaming in distress in a residence. Upon arrival, officers found a man holding a woman at knifepoint inside. Police shot and killed the man.

name: Jose Manuel Ramirez Jr.
circumstances: About 1 p.m., officers were deployed to a home after receiving a call about shots fired. Jose Manuel Ramirez Jr. climbed to the roof of the house and exchanged fire with police using an AK-47 rifle and a handgun before shot and killed five hours after the siege began. After he was killed, inside the residence, police found three people dead, identified as Ramirez's sons and their mother. Deputy Phillip Campas was killed, and another officer was wounded.

name: Jesus Salvado Valeta
circumstances: Police reportedly saw a car leaving the scene of a shooting and stopped it away from the scene. Valeta allegedly fled the traffic stop with a gun in hand. He was eventaully confronted by two police officers near a fast-food restaurant who shot and killed him.

name: Gerardo Martinez
circumstances: A neighbor called police on Martinez stating he was drunk and holding a bb gun. The neighbor thought Martinez may also be under the influence of drugs. Upon arrival, police shot and killed Martinez.

name: Matthew James Sova
circumstances: Police responded to multiple calls about an individual brandishing a gun on Hollywood Blvd. After identifyign the man, police shot and killed the man. The individual was holding a toy gun.
initial_reason: person with a gun (gun was a toy)

name: Name withheld by police
circumstances: Police began a pursuit after spotting an undisclosed vehicle violation. When police stopped the car, a passenger fled on foot. The driver continued to drive away from police and was eventually boxed in by police. Police claim the driver attempted to use the vehicle as a weapon and police shot and killed the individual.

name: Steven Adam Calderon
agency_responsible: "Paso Robles Police Department, San Luis Obispo Police Department"
circumstances: Police responded to reports of gunfire at an apartment complex. Calderon had reportedly shot from an apartment's balcony and threatened to shoot his girlfriend. Calderon barricaded himself in an apartment and continued firing the gun. A SWAT team deployed chemical weapons to try and get Calderon out of the apartment. Eventually, Calderon exited the apartment, set the gun down, and spoke with officers. Police claim Calderon lunged towards the gun, and police shot and killed him.

name: Jerome Barber
circumstances: Police responded to a domestic dispute call. Upon arrival, they allegedly encountered an individual with a large knife in hand. The individual continued walking in and out of the home, appearing irritated. Police claim the individual rushed at officers, who deployed less-lethal munitions. Police allege the individual charged at them again, and police shot and killed them.

name: Soobleej Kaub Hawj Hawj
agency_responsible: "Siskiyou County Sheriff's Office, California Department of Fish and Wildlife, Etna Police Department"
circumstances: Police were assisting with wildfire evacuations and had blocked off a section of road. A driver reportedly ignored directions to avoid the evacuation zone and police claim pointed a gun while speaking with law enforcement. Officers from several departments opened fire on the driver, killing them.

name: Christopher Garcia
circumstances: A pursuit began on Laurel Canyon Boulevard, where officers spotted a blue Honda commit a traffic violation. The driver fled, and officers pursued. The pursuit entered the northbound 5 Freeway, where the driver exited on the off ramp to Terra Bella. The man lost control of the car on the freeway exit, and as soon as the car came to rest, the driver exited the car armed with a handgun, and officers shot and killed him.
officer_names: Edgar Simental, Ricardo Mota, Joshua Fluty, Ruben Ovsepyan
officer_known_past_shootings: 1 (Joshua Fluty nonfatally shot at Raymond Paul Rodriguez in 2009)

name: Name withheld by police
circumstances: At about 2 p.m., an officer pulled over a car with two men inside in the parking lot of a hotel. The driver allegedly got out of the car, confronted and punched the officer, police said. The man broke free and ran to the back of the hotel, police said. The officer chased the man and was allegedly struck after coming around a corner. They struggled on the ground, and the officer shot and killed the man.

name: Abraham Torres Meza
circumstances: Police attempted to pull over a vehicle for a vehicle code violation. The driver did not stop and led officers on a pursuit, and eventually crashed. Three men reportedly exited the vehicle and ran away, one of which was allegedly armed with a shotgun. An officer shot and killed the man.

name: Name withheld by police
circumstances: About 10:38 p.m., officers responded to the 5400 block of W. Industrial Parkway to investigate a grand theft auto report, and later, during a night patrol check, neighboring officers with the Colton Police Department found the vehicle and initiated a pursuit. The pursuit eventually ended on the eastbound 10 Freeway just west of Sierra Avenue. Police shot and killed the driver. Details as to what precipitated the killing were withheld by police.

name: Fred Holder
circumstances: Deputies responded to reports of a van driving erratically and attempted a traffic stop. Deputies claim the man inside the car produced an object that looked like a handgun, and at least one deputy shot and killed him. After the shooting, deputies saw the object was not in fact a handgun.
officer_names: Jackie Rojas, Javier Fierros, Christopher Conger

name: Eric Scott Anderson
circumstances: Deputies responded to reports of a "suspicious person" in a vacant lot. Deputies made contact with the individual, Anderson, and claim he pulled out a handgun. Deputies shot and killed Anderson. There are no other details available at this time.

name: Juan Miguel Bejar
circumstances: Police wanted Juan Miguel Bejar for assault with a deadly weapon in Ventura County. Following a pursuit, Bejar got out of his vehicle holding a gun, and deputies shot and killed him.

name: Manuel Rojas Barajas
street_address: East Third Street and Paulin Avenue
circumstances: Two men were reportedly in an altercation and someone called the police. Witnesses state one man had a weapon and would not drop it when asked. Police shot and killed him.

name: Joe Ruiz
circumstances: Joe Ruiz refused to pull over when an officer tried to pull him over. He crashed into a car while fleeing and then got out of the car. Ruiz allegedly had a gun when he and six different officers exchanged fire. Ruiz was taken to Kern Medical with at least six gunshot wounds and died three days later.
officer_names: Travione Sherell, Raymond Hackleman, Jose Medrano, Paul Madriz, Eli Brown, Robert Robles

name: Kenneth Earl Mackey
circumstances: Police responded to a disturbance involving multiple people about 1 a.m. in a bar parking lot. When the officers arrived, they reportedly saw Kenneth Earl Mackey shooting a handgun. They did not state if he fired at the officers. They shot and killed Mackey.

name: Juan DeLeCruz Rodriguez
circumstances: Deputies responded at about 7:40 p.m. to a report of a suspicious vehicle and a driver acting strangely in a city park. As deputies arrived, he allegedly fled and drove into oncoming traffic. Deputies caught up to the man in a business parking lot at 57200 29 Palms Highway. Juan DeLeCruz Rodriguez reportedly was uncooperative and put the vehicle in reverse and collided with a patrol car. Moments later, a deputy shot and killed him. A knife reportedly fell from Rodriguez's lap as he was pulled from the car.

name: Name withheld by police
circumstances: Officers responded to a dog park on reports that a person was armed. Upon arrival, the individual had left the park, and began to search for the person. An officer eventually contacted the person, and claims the individual pulled a handgun out of their pocket. The officer shot and killed the person.

name: Demetrius Stanley
circumstances: Two officers responded to a call around 9:45 p.m. While police were investigating the initial report, they were confronted by the person they were reportedly looking for, who allegedly pointed a gun at them, and police shot and killed Demetrius Stanley

name: Bilal Winston Shabazz
circumstances: Deputies attempting to pull over a motorcyclist in Yucca Valley engaged in a high-speed chase and shootout, with one deputy, Dominic Vaca, 43, fatally shot, and the motorcyclist killed by deputies in the gunfight.

name: Name withheld by police
circumstances: About 1:10 a.m., officers saw a "suspicious occupied vehicle" parked behind a closed, vacant business. As officers attempted to make contact with the man inside the vehicle, he shot at officers, striking the front windshield of a patrol unit, and police shot and killed him.

name: Manuel Beltran Moreno
agency_responsible: "Kings County Sheriff's Office, California Highway Patrol"
circumstances: Deputies with the Kings County Sheriff's Office were called to assist the pursuit of a vehicle that had started in San Luis Obispo County. The pursuit ended and the suspect allegedly confronted California Highway Patrol officers with a firearm and wearing a tactical vest. Law enforcement began negotiating with the individual, and a SWAT team and Crisis Resolution team was eventually brought in. Negotiations lasted around 10 hours, before the suspect allgedly confront and engaged a member of the SWAT team by allegedly firing a round in their direction. Multiple law enforcement personnel returned fire and the individual died at the scene.

name: Patrick Watkins
circumstances: Officers responded to a report of a man holding a gun and banging on an apartment door. Upon arrival, they encountered the man on a staircase and attempted to speak with him. The man went upstairs, and officers claim he was holding a gun. Police ordered the man drop the gun, and allege he turned towards officers and pointed the gun at him. The officers shot and killed him.

name: Xander Mann
circumstances: Police pursued Xander Mann, with four teenage passengers in the vehicle, for more than 7-miles through Modesto after failing to stop for a traffic violation. A deputy used his vehicle to disable the car, forcing it sideways to a stop. Deputy Gerardo Zazueta shot and killed the boy.

name: Name withheld by police
circumstances: Around 5 p.m. at the Monterey Park Fire Department's headquarters, an officer was nearing the end of his shift and went to the fire station to gas up. A man in a Nissan sport-utility vehicle followed the officer, who went to a secured parking lot. The officer parked and got out. The man, who had a knife, got out of his vehicle and allegedly charged the officer. The officer shot and killed him.

name: Silvestre Vargas Estrada
circumstances: An agent tried to stop a vehicle suspected of being involved in migrant smuggling. The vehicle did not stop, and after a brief pursuit, the vehicle stopped at a gas station. Three agents shot into the vehicle, and the driver was shot and killed.

name: Michael Alvarez
circumstances: Police responded to reports of an attempted kidnapping. Michael Alvarez led police on a chase that ended near southbound Highway 99 and I-5. It was at that point CHP took over. The driver refused to get out of the car or listen to commands and crashed the car before stopping. After an hour-long negotiation with him, officers got the man out of the car by deploying a Taser, killing him.

name: Lance Lowe
circumstances: Officer Jimmy Inn responded to a domestic disturbance call from Lowe's residence. Police allege Lowe answered the door and shot Officer Inn, and then allegedly exchanged gunfire with another officer before re-entering the home. Lowe then allegedly emerged with his child, before a bystander tackled Lowe. Lowe was then shot and killed by police.

name: Edward Zamora Giron
circumstances: Officers were serving a search warrant at an apartment. One officer was shot and killed, and a second officer was shot and wounded. Police killed Edward Zamora Giron.

name: Felix Jerry Marquez
circumstances: Officers who were part of a homeless outreach unit encountered Marquez and claim he pulled a handgun, pointing it at them. The officers shot and killed Marquez.

name: Luis Perez-Munoz
circumstances: Deputies responded to an assault with a deadly weapon call at 7:21 p.m. and learned that a man had struck another person with a crowbar during an argument. When deputies arrived, they found the man in a nearby field still in possession of the crowbar. Deputies reportedly fired a Taser at the man after he failed to comply with commands, but it was ineffective. The man allegedly advanced toward one of the deputies with the crowbar in his hand, and a deputy shot and killed him.

name: Mark Aitulagi Lavea
circumstances: Around 10:30 p.m., dispatchers got a call about an argument between a man and a woman at the Sierra Inn Motel. During the incident, the man allegedly pointed a gun at the woman's head. The suspect left before deputies arrived. A search started, and the man shot a deputy who was interviewing the victim. Police started searching the apartment complex. Eventually, the man emerged from an apartment holding an elderly woman hostage with a gun. Officers shot and killed Mark Aitulagi Lavea and shot and wounded the hostage.
officer_names: Michael Jericoff, Nicholas Riviera, Mark Silvia, Brandon Buie

name: Alfredo Aceves
circumstances: Deputies responded to reports of a man allegedly firing a shotgun at people on a road. Deputies established a perimeter and eventually found the person. Deputies shot and killed the person, details are sparse surrounding the events leading up to the shooting.

name: Dalton James Gerrit Kooiman
circumstances: Police attempted to stop a reportedly stolen vehicle. The driver failed to yield and crashed the vehicle, exited and ran off. Officers attempted to take Kooiman into custody, and Kooiman allegedly shot at officers, who returned fire, killing Kooiman.

name: Carlos Lopez-Melendez
circumstances: Carlos Lopez-Melendez allegedly killed two people and injured a third during a shooting spree at five different locations in Los Angeles. Lopez was killed during a standoff with police after a lengthy chase that ended on the 91 Freeway in Fullerton.

name: Richard Solitro
circumstances: Solitro allegedly cut off a patrol car before putting his vehicle into reverse and striking the patrol vehicle. Solitro allegedly exited the vehicle with a hand behind his back. Police shot and killed him.

name: Steven John Olson
circumstances: Police responded to a report of a man hitting cars with a pole. An officer responded to the scene, and the man ran off. The first officer states the man was not a threat to the public. A second officer spotted the man on the street, and claims the man charged at him. The second officer allegedly told the man to drop the pole, and the man continued to walk towards the officer. The second officer shot and killed the man.

name: Mario Gonzalez Arenales
circumstances: Police responded to reports of a man under the influence and a potential theft. Upon arrival, police allege a scuffle ensued. Body camera footage shows officers on top of Gonzalez while he was restrained on the ground, placing their weight on his head and back. Gonzalez was taken to a hospital and died.
officer_names: James Fisher, Cameron Leahy, Eric McKinley, Charlie Clemmens

name: Matthew Harry
circumstances: Deputies responded to a call concerning a man with a gun. When deputies arrived, Harry allegedly fired multiple shots. Deputies returned fire, killing Harry.

name: Christopher Templo Marquez
circumstances: Christopher Templo Marquez was suspected of shooting at police, and he hid in a Dumpster on the campus of San Diego High School for about 11 hours. Police said Marquez grew increasingly agitated as the standoff continued. Police reportedly heard Marquez make threatening comments, then saw him push the woman into a position where they believed he was about to shoot her. Two police snipers shot and killed Marquez.
officer_names: Brandon Jordan, Brandon Gibson, Robert Rude Jr.

name: Guillermo Amezcua
circumstances: Officers responded to a call of shots fired. They eventually found a vehicle and person who matched a description given by an informant and attempted to contact the man in the vehicle. Police allege he was uncooperative and fired at officers. Police returned fire and killed the man.

name: Gabriel Munoz Jr.
circumstances: A motorist called the police reporting a man was throwing rocks at passing vehicles. A deputy arrived at the scene, and found the man allegedly smashing the window of a parked car with a tire iron. The deputy ordered the man to stop and drop the tire iron, but the man allegedly began walking toward the interstate. The deputy then drove ahead to stop traffic as the man was walking on the freeway. The deputy repeatedly asked the man to drop the tire iron and get off the freeway, and at one point the man allegedly ran at the deputy with the tire iron in hand. The deputy shot and killed the man.

name: Roger Cornelius Allen
circumstances: Around 1:55 p.m., Daly City police shot and killed a man. All details as to what precipitated the killing were withheld.
officer_names: Michael Brennan, Rosa Brenes, Nicholas McCarthy, Cameron Newton

name: Devin Wyteagle Kuykendall
circumstances: The police department determined the location of a stolen 2004 White Ford F-250. The vehicle was found by officers as the pickup reportedly was driven recklessly. Officers pursued when the suspect refused to stop. Police reportedly ended the pursuit, but the vehicle continued to flee until it collided with a passenger car. The three people in the vehicle were not injured. Devin Wyteagle Kuykendall fled the pickup and began running westbound while armed with a rifle. Kuykendall allegedly fired several shots at officers. On the east curb of Court Street, he allegedly approached a vehicle with a door open and fired shots into the air when a Redding officer shot and killed him.

name: Juan Carlos Estrada
circumstances: About 6:25 p.m., deputies approached a home looking for Juan Carlos Estrada. Deputies ordered him to exit the home over their patrol vehicle speakers. Estrada failed to follow deputies' commands. In the meantime, a sheriff's dispatcher reportedly received a call from inside the home suggesting Estrada was armed with a gun. Estrada exited the home running toward the deputies and their patrol cars, and at least one deputy shot and killed him.

name: Lauren Nicole Archibeque
circumstances: About 5:15 a.m., police shot and killed a woman after officers said she pointed a rifle at them as they responded to a 911 call regarding a man who possibly had a heart attack and a suicidal woman. In addition to the woman who was shot, a man was found dead inside the home.

name: Angel Nelson
circumstances: Police conducting surveillance at the Welcome Inn at around 5:30 p.m. when they spotted a person in the parking lot and attempted to take him into custody. At some point while attempting to arrest Angel Nelson, members of the Gang Impact Team shot and killed him.

name: Stephen Patrick Moseley
circumstances: Police were trailing a man who they allege had several felony warrants and may have been armed.Two officers approached the man and confronted him.When the man was attacked by a police dog, he allegedly produced a firearm, and police shot and killed him.

name: Ivan Cuevas
circumstances: Police received a call from a person who said there was a man with a knife threatening family members. The first officer at the house on North Conyer Street was confronted by Ivan Cuevas, who charged at him with a knife, and the officer shot and killed Cuevas.

name: Lance Montgomery Powell
circumstances: Officers responded about 3:30 p.m. after receiving a report of a man who threatened the reporting party and gestured as though he had a weapon. Upon arrival, the officers ordered the man to do unspecified things, as he walked toward a trailer, but he failed to comply. The man then allegedly turned toward the officers and started shooting at them with a handgun. The officers shot and killed Lance Montgomery Powell.

name: Matthew Blaylock
street_address: W. 7th St. and S. Bixel St.
circumstances: LAPD officers were trying to stop a pedestrian for unspecified reasons at about 3:45 a.m. The man, Matthew Blaylock, allegedly ran from officers, and the officers chased him on foot. Blaylock allegedly pulled out a gun, and the police shot and killed him.
officer_names: Giovanny Ramirez Barona and David Voci

name: Krys Brandon Ruiz
circumstances: Krys Brandon Ruiz was shot and killed after police responded for a report of a person walking with a gun. The officers involved in the incident have been identified by the police department as Corporal Andrew White and Officer Mauricio Calderon. Details as to what precipitated the killing were withheld by police.

name: Joshua Gloira
circumstances: Officers chased a robbery suspect in a stolen vehicle for a short time. Once the chase ended, the person was shot and killed.

name: Samuel Ponce
circumstances: Officers responded to reports of a man armed with a hammer and hatchet. When officers arrived, an altercation allegedly occurred and the police shot the man.

name: Caleb Smith
circumstances: A Volvo with white paper license plate on the rear bumper was identified as the suspect vehicle in the recent robbery of an elderly woman. A vehicle matching the description was spotted by officers patrolling an area where several similar robberies had been committed since December, and the driver and occupants sped away when officers tried to stop them. An investigation led officers to the Motel 6, where officers attempted to stop the occupants of a car matching the description of the Volvo. An officer shot and killed the driver of the car after he struck police vehicles.
officer_names: Michael Miller, Dynaton Tran, Chris Suozzo

name: Jorge Armando Cerda
circumstances: Police responded around 12:15 p.m. to investigate reports of someone firing a rifle into the air. The lot involved contains two residences, a front and a back, and the gunman was in the rear yard. The man barricaded himself in a home. Other family members were evacuated. Police tried to coax the man from the home, including sending in recording of his family members pleading for him to surrender. When that was unsuccessful, they used tear gas,and the man began firing from the home. When additional rounds of tear gas were sent into the home, the man came out and exchanged gunfire with police. Police shot and killed Jorge Armando Cerda.

name: David Ordaz
circumstances: Deputies responded to a call about a suicidal 34-year-old man. Deputies found a man armed with a knife inside a car who refused to drop the weapon and get out, and that they called for a mental evaluation team, but before it arrived, the man got out holding a knife, who turned toward the deputies and began to charge. They reportedly fired a less-than-lethal stun bag at him, but that he charged again, and at least one deputy shot and killed him.

name: Tyrell Wilson
street_address: Sycamore Valley Road and Camino Ramon
circumstances: Police received calls from more than one motorist that a man was throwing rocks off the overpass of Sycamore Valley Road onto Interstate 680. Tyrell Wilson allegedly pulled out a folding knife when confronted by Officer Andrew Hall. Hall reportedly ordered Wilson to drop the knife. Wilson advanced toward the officer, who shot and killed him.

name: Ivan Gutzalenko
circumstances: Police responded to a 10:35 a.m. report of a man damaging property inside a business. Officers arrived and found a man who was stumbling and who fell to the ground and appeared to be in medical distress or under the influence of drugs, police said. They tried to calm the man and provided medical assistance until paramedics arrived. Officers placed the man in a prone position and one officer placed his knee on the man's lower back to handcuff him. The man was dead a short time later.

name: Jehlani Black
circumstances: Officers responded to a report of possible vandalism, made contact with an individual, and began a foot pursuit. The individual was allegedly armed with a gun. One officer fired, killing the person.

name: David Kahler
circumstances: Officers were sent to a Quality Inn on reports an unsupervised child was wandering around the parking lot. While investigating, officers came in contact with a man in a vehicle. At some point in their interaction, officers shot the man. Details as to what led up to the shooting are unavailable at this time.

name: Adam John Lundt
circumstances: Officers were called to a Walmart on reports of a man with a knife. It has not been clarified if Lundt had a knife at the time of the shooting, and police have not provided further details as to what led to the shooting.
initial_reason: person with a knife (unclear if Lundt was armed)

name: Arturo Gomez Calel
street_address: James Donlon Boulevard and S Royal Links Circle
circumstances: Arturo Gomez Calel was having an apparent mental health crisis died in a struggle with police after he was tasered in a roadway just after midnight.

name: Name withheld by police
circumstances: Officers tried to pull a motorist over for a vehicle code violation at 11:55 p.m. when he fled. After a brief pursuit, the man, pursued by at least three police cruisers, drove onto North Beverly Court, a short dead-end road. There, the driver allegedly rammed into three police cars. One officer who reportedly had gotten out of a police vehicle, shot and killed him.

name: Name withheld by police
circumstances: About 10:30 a.m., officers were patrolling, and they made contact with three people in a parked vehicle. They removed two passengers. As the officers attempted to contact the driver, he allegedly reversed the vehicle and struck one of the passengers, and the officers shot and killed him.

name: Chad Curtis Loynachan
circumstances: A deputy was taking an inmate to the hospital for evaluation. There was a struggle, and the inmate allegedly attempted to reach for the officer's weapon. The deputy shot and killed Chad Loynachan.
initial_reason: transporting to hospital, arrested for drugs and weapons possession

name: Hector Javier Puga
circumstances: CHP officers chased a white Ford Expedition driven by a man suspected of shooting at people in a vehicle. The driver reportedly struck a spike strip set up by police, but he kept driving. He eventually stopped the Expedition, but refused to get out of the vehicle. Unspecified less-than-lethal methods reportedly were used to get the man to comply but were unsuccessful. After more than an hour, the man got out and went to the front of the vehicle and began shooting at the officers, who shot and killed him. Apparently, officers also shot and wounded three bystanders in a nearby home.

name: Francisco Flores
circumstances: Police were called to a report of a suspect stealing items from a nearby store and spotted a man who matched the description of the robbery suspect on a corner near the freeway. When officers tried to approach the man, he fled. An officer caught up with the suspect and a fight ensued. When a second arrived, the shooting occurred.

name: Royce Robertston
circumstances: Robertson and another drive got in a dispute. Deputies say Robertson got out of his vehicle and confronted the other driver, allegedly with a handgun. Deputies then followed Robertson and when confronted Robertson allegedly pulled a gun. Deputies shot him multiple times.

name: Daverion Kinard
circumstances: Officers were sent to a woman's home after getting a report of a burglary in progress. They arrived to find a man inside the home, and they tried to arrest him. He ran from them, and they chased him through several neighborhoods. Officers found him hiding in an outbuilding and shot and killed him. Details as to what precipitated the killing were withheld by police.

name: Brooke Leann Blair
circumstances: At 11:25 a.m., Redding officers responded to a report of a man waving a gun in the air. When the officers arrived, they said they found two men and a woman on the south curb line of the Cypress Avenue Bridge. The people initially were cooperative, but as they were talking, Brooke Leann Blair retrieved a replica handgun from her waistband and raised it up, and officers shot and killed her.
officer_names: Jeremiah Kasinger, Nate Sweeney, Brett Leonard

name: Anthony Loia
circumstances: At around 9:15 p.m., officers went to the area after they received a call about a man with a gun. When they arrived, they found a man armed with a gun and ordered him to drop his firearm. When he failed to do so, they shot and killed him.

name: Ariella Sage Eloise Crawford
street_address: Alta Sierra Drive and Names Drive
circumstances: Around 1 p.m., police received several calls regarding a woman walking in the middle of Alta Sierra Drive with two small children. The reporting parties advised that the woman was possibly under the influence of alcohol or drugs. Several deputies responded and made contact with the woman, and Within minutes, Deputies Deputy Caleb Toderean and Matthew Harrison shot and killed her. She was reportedly afraid the deputies were there to take her children, and she allegedly had a knife.

name: Karl Walker
circumstances: CHP officers were responding to a car accident and saw a car on the shoulder of I-80 with a damaged back window. An officer attempted to speak to the driver, Walker, who allegedly suddenly grabbed a firearm and threatened the officer. Officers shot Walker.
initial_reason: car crash, welfare check for erratic behavior, possible intoxication

name: Javier Magdaleno
agency_responsible: "Riverside County Sheriff's Department, Indio Police Department, Califonia Highway Patrol"
circumstances: Deputies responded at 12:40 p.m. to reports of an assault with a deadly weapon. The man was reportedly armed with a rifle, police said, and the victim ran into a business prior to 911 being called. When police arrived, the suspect drove away fast in a red Ford pickup truck, which started a pursuit with California Highway Patrol officers. The pursuit ended in a crash on Jefferson St. in La Quinta, where deputies shot and killed the man.

name: Randy Miller
circumstances: Officers responded about 10:30 p.m. to a call of a person who said he was assaulted by a man with a knife and that the suspect was assaulting a woman. Upon arrival, officers reportedly saw the man inside a vehicle assaulting the woman, and police shot and killed him.

name: Mark Meza
street_address: Davis Street and Bella Vista Road
circumstances: Around 8:35 p.m., police said Mark Meza, was doing doughnuts and otherwise driving erratically in his gray Dodge Dakota behind City Hall. An officer attempted a traffic stop but he fled, and multiple officers pursued him. Officers apparently rammed his vehicle off the road, then three officers shot and killed Meza. Details as to what precipitated the killing were withheld by police.

name: Steven Emmet Crosby
circumstances: A man who reportedly threatened his estranged wife at gunpoint while her two children were present in her home was shot and killed by a deputy during an exchange of gunfire.

name: Jose Albert Lizarraga Garcia
circumstances: Jose Garcia reportedly was acting suspiciously, going in and out of stores near Cardenas Market. Police said he became combative and was restrained, killing him.

name: David Tovar Jr.
circumstances: Police shot and killed David Tovar Jr. at a San Jose apartment complex. He was unarmed but a suspect in connection with a homicide and two other shootings in South Santa Clara County. Police said he was reaching into his waistband on a second-floor landing, as officers looked on from a ground-level courtyard, when they shot him.

name: Frank Gonzales
street_address: Kings Canyon Rd. and Maple Ave.
circumstances: Officers were contacted by a state parole agent requesting help of finding a parolee who had possibly removed his ankle monitor. Police found Gonzales behind a business and approached him. Police allege Gonzales lunged at officers with a metal tool in his hand. Officers fired, striking and killing Gonzales.

name: Robert Stephen Calderon
street_address: Hurley Way and Cal Expo Drive
circumstances: Deputies attempted a traffic stop a little after 10 p.m. Deputies chased Robert Stephen Calderon for nearly 15 minutes before crashing his vehicle outside the Cal Expo race track. After the crash, deputies tried getting the driver to exit his car, but he wouldn't roll down his windows or get out of the car. Deputies broke the back window of theCalderon's car and put a dog inside the car to attack Calderon. Calderon allegedly shot and killed the dog and then allegedly began firing on deputies, who shot and killed him.

name: Kershawn Geiger
circumstances: A police officer and a person exchanged gunfire, killing the person and injuring the officer around 8:15 p.m. When police arrived, they found the officer suffering from a gunshot wound. They also found a suspect who had been shot dead by the officer.

name: Joshua Van Machado
street_address: S Court St and W Beech Ave
circumstances: Officers were dispatched after receiving calls of a bank robbery. A patrol officer spotted a vehicle matching the description of the suspect's, and pulled the vehicle over. The suspect got out of the vehicle, and was allegedly armed with a handgun. Officers allege the suspect began to move the gun towards them, and fired several rounds at the suspect after commanding him to drop the weapon.

name: Allen Mirzayan
circumstances: At 4:08 p.m., LASD deputies were patrolling when a woman who was a stabbing victim flagged them down. Deputies contacted a person with a knife and shot and killed Allen Mirzayan.
officer_names: Raul Reyes, Jacob Thome, Roberto Sigala

name: Betty Francois
circumstances: Deputies responded to a 911 call just after 9:30 a.m. regarding unknown subjects attempting to break into her home. Betty Francois, 91, made the 911 call. Deputies arrived and Francois allegedly came out of the home armed with a shotgun. Deputies gave her commands to drop the gun, then she pointed the gun at the deputies, and a deputy shot and killed her when she failed to comply. Francois was blind and deaf.

name: David Alvarado Jr.
street_address: San Gabriel Boulevard and Dewey Avenue
circumstances: Around 11:17 p.m., San Gabriel police officers pulled over the driver, his identity or whether or not the officials were wearing body cameras, only saying that a driver allegedly produced a handgun, and an officer shot and killed him.

name: Trevor Seever
circumstances: At around 11:40 a.m., Modesto officers responded to a security check call in the area of Woodland and Rosemore avenues, where a subject was reportedly in possession of a firearm. Police exchanged gunfire with the man and shot and killed him at the Church of the Brethren. Details were withheld by police.

name: Shyheed Robert Boyd
street_address: E Baseline Street and Elm Street
circumstances: A San Bernardino officer and a man reportedly wanted for questioning regarding a murder exchanged gunfire. Shyheed Boyd allegedly was responsible for the Dec. 9 shooting death of Moreno Valley resident Donte Dejuan Carr, 40. The man was killed and the deputy reportedly injured. Details about the killing were withheld by police.

name: Name withheld by police
circumstances: A 33-year-old man was being sought for the crimes of attempted murder, residential robbery and assault with a deadly weapon in the Barstow area. Police contacted the man, who was a passenger in a car. The driver got out, and the man moved into the driver's seat. He reportedly rammed their patrol cars. He got out, armed with a machete. Deputies fired less-lethal projectiles, and he dropped the machete. But when he allegedly tried to arm himself with a rifle, deputies shot and killed him.

name: Tara Rae Liubakka
street_address: Browning St. and Old Alturas Rd.
circumstances: Following a series of crimes including a shooting, a carjacking, and driving a car through Walmart, police shot and killed a woman when she came toward him with two knives.

name: Angelo Quinto
circumstances: Quinto's sister called the police as he was acting erratically. When police arrived, Quinto's mother was seated on the floor embracing him. Police then flipped Quinto over and pinned him on his stomach. One officer held his legs down and another knelt on his neck. Quinto's family state the officer knelt on his neck for five minutes. Quinto lost consciousness, and police attempted to revive him on scene. Quinto passed at a hospital three days later.

name: Moises Arreola
circumstances: Deputies responded about 7 p.m. following a report of a gunshot victim. When they arrived, they found an armed man who was standing near a driveway. Deputies apparently shot him once, and when he attempted to raise his gun again, shot and killed him.

name: Johnathan George Brown
circumstances: Police responded to a call of a person who was making suicidal statements and walking around with a gun. When officers arrived, they attempted to talk to him. He allegedly tried to pull out a gun from his waistband, and an officer shot him with a less-lethal foam bullet. The man ran from officers while shooting at them. One officer was struck, suffering major injuries, another officer was grazed by a bullet. Police shot and killed the man.

name: Name withheld by police
circumstances: A man had allegedly brandished a knife toward an employee of a Sinclair gas station about 5:20 a.m., prompting the employee to run inside, lock the front door and call police. When deputies arrived, they found the man sitting inside his car and tried to get him to surrender by speaking to him with a PA system. The man then placed the car in reverse and backed up, colliding with a patrol vehicle. Deputies reportedly shot at the man with less-than-lethal rounds before shooting and killing him.

name: Ernie Teddy Serrano
circumstances: Ernie Teddy Serrano was acting erratically in a grocery stores. He was beaten, tasered and killed.

name: Jordan Zenka
circumstances: Sacramento police responded to reports of a knife-wielding suspect inside a grocery store. The officer engaged with the man for 20 minutes to drop the knife, and the man was seen hurting himself with the knife. Allegedly the man charged officers with the knife, and after less-lethal weapons were deployed, officers opened fire.

name: Christian Juarez
circumstances: After multiple chases, a deputy shot and killed a kidnapping suspect who drove an SUV into the officer's patrol vehicle at the parking lot of an apartment complex.

name: Dolores Hernandez
circumstances: Officers were called to the Discovery Village shopping center in Redding Wednesday evening, where Dolores Hernandez was yelling and cursing at patrons of a pizza parlor, police said. The woman left but continued to cause a disturbance in the parking lot for about 20 minutes before a security guard who had confronted her called police, police said. Arriving officers found the woman in a car. In trying to leave. She allegedly nearly hit an officer, then backed up, hitting an officer with a front tire. He fell down and was reportedly pinned under the tire. The other officer shot and killed the woman.

name: Nicolas Segura
circumstances: Officers responded to a call about a family disturbance. Officers responded to the home after multiple family members called 911 to report that Nicolas Segura was threatening to stab relatives with a knife while possibly under the influence of methamphetamine. Police said he charged at them with a knife, and they shot and killed him.

name: Name withheld by police
circumstances: Beaumont Police and California Highway Patrol Officers were called at 7:44 p.m. and made contact with a man at a business. He was armed with two knives, and advanced toward the officers who shot and killed him.

name: Name withheld by police
street_address: Van Wick St. and Van Ness Ave.
circumstances: A caller reported a man in the middle of the street holding a firearm about 1:50 a.m. at an intersection. As deputies arrived, they saw a man pointing a firearm at a passing by vehicle. The deputies told the man to drop the weapon, but he allegedly turned and pointed the weapon at the deputies, who shot and killed him.
initial_reason: Person with a gun, erratic behavior

name: Augustine Morales
circumstances: Around 8 p.m., officers responded to reports of vehicles being driven recklessly and, upon arrival, saw a large crowd of people running from a building. One person reported to an officer that there was a man armed with a gun in the area. The officer confronted the armed man -- who was pointing his gun at a crowd of people inside of the warehouse -- and shot and killed him.

name: Daniel David Reyes
circumstances: A single deputy responded to a report of a suspicious person at around 8:40 p.m. The person reportedly was armed, and the deputy shot and killed Daniel Reyes. Details as to what precipitated the killing were withheld by police.

name: Saul Robert Salgado
circumstances: Police received a 911 call about 5:50 p.m. during which they heard screaming in the background and believed there was a crash at the intersection of Telegraph Road and Norwalk Boulevard. The first officer to arrive encountered an armed man, who charged the officer, and the officer shot and killed him.

name: David Viveros
circumstances: Police Department responded to a call of a shooting at a gas station. As police were investigating, a man who police say had no connection to the shooting approached one of the officers and attacked the officer with a knife. Two additional officers ran over to try and stop the man, David Viveros. Officers tried to use a Taser on Viveros twice, but he allegedly kept attacking. Viveros stabbed one of the officers in the abdomen. One of the officers shot and killed Viveros.

name: Javier Magana
circumstances: Javier Magana was armed with a handgun and was wanted in connection with a shooting in Oxnard. Oxnard police tried to pull him over, but he fled and police pursued from Oxnard into Ventura where Ventura police took over. The pursuit ended after his vehicle hit spike strips twice. Magana allegedly got out of his vehicle and a Ventura PD officer shot and killed him.

name: Michael Wright
circumstances: Police were called to an apartment on Park City Court around 8 p.m. after reports of a stabbing. A person who had been stabbed multiple times was found on the floor surrounded by a large amount of blood. Officers said the suspect was still threatening the victim with a knife. At least one officer shot and killed the man with the knife.

name: Jonathan Torres Ramirez
circumstances: Around 10:15 p.m. officers interrupted an attempted burglary and robbery of a cannabis grow inside a building. The burglary was one of several officers responded to, as a group police described as a "caravan of armed robbers" robbed or attempted to rob several marijuana businesses, and broke into other cannabis stores and businesses throughout Oakland. Officers tried to stop several people, but some fled on foot or in vehicles, police said. One Oakland officer shot and killed the 20-year-old man.

name: Justin Esqueda
circumstances: Around 2:47 p.m., deputies were called for a possible shooting. When they arrived, they found a person suffering from a major injury gunshot wound. Deputies also encountered Justin Esqueda with a rifle, and exchanged gunfire with him. Esqueda was killed during a subsequent running gunbattle.
officer_names: Christopher Gonzalez, Miguel Orozco, Vidal Contreras

name: Bruce Allan Shumaker
street_address: Garry Oak Drive and Twin Oaks Avenue
circumstances: Police were investigating a dispute between the man and his neighbor around 3:30 p.m. when the man pointed a handgun at officers. At least one officer shot at the man. Police set up a perimeter and closed off the roadways in the area. About 5:30 p.m. the man left the house out the back door and pointed a weapon at the officers who shot and killed him.

name: Daniel Angel Villalobos-Baldovinos
circumstances: A U.S. Border Patrol agent shot and killed a man involved in an altercation with the agent on federal property near the U.S.-Mexico border in San Ysidro. The man, a non-U.S. citizen, was involved in an altercation with the agent on federal property, but police withheld details as to what caused the fight.

name: Name withheld by police
circumstances: Around 11:21 p.m., the Fontana Police Department attempted to pull over a driver in Colton. He was reportedly wanted in a recent criminal case. The driver failed to yield, and police pursued. When the pursuit ended in Loma Linda on the eastbound 10 Freeway, gunfire was exchanged between the Fontana police officers and the driver, who was shot and killed.

name: Mark Matthew Bender
circumstances: A San Bernardino officer responded to calls of a man armed with a gun jumping on cars in a convenience store parking lot. The officer gave Bender verbal commands, Bender allegedly refused to follow commands and attempted to walk into the convenience store. The officer attempted to physically restrain Bender, and a physical altercation occurred. Bender was able to get away from the officer and allegedly pulled a weapon from his pocket. The officer shot at Bender four times.
initial_reason: Person with a gun, erratic behavior

name: Name withheld by police
street_address: I-15, south of Outlet Center Drive
circumstances: At around 2:40 a.m., the CHP took over a pursuit on the northbound I-15 in Chino that continued through the Cajon Pass into the Barstow area. Just before 4 a.m., there was an exchange of gunfire, and the officer was injured, and the person fleeing was killed.

name: Jose Alfredo Castro-Gutierrez
circumstances: Jose Alfredo Castro-Gutierrez allegedly threatened officers with a curtain rod, and they shot and killed him. The incident started as a domestic violence incident.

name: Gregory Putnik
street_address: N Weber Ave & W Olive Ave
circumstances: Officers first responded to a failed carjacking by Putnik. Putnik had ran to a nearby home and climbed onto the roof. The homeowner came outside of their home with a rifle, confronted Putnik, and scared him off the property. Outside, Putnik was confronted by another neighbor and the two engaged in a physical altercation. Officers arrived on the scene, and Putnik ran into the same home he had climbed up onto. Inside the home, Putnik secured the homeowner's rifle and allegedly fired at a group of teenagers and officers. Officers fired bean-bag rounds at Putnik, and later shot him.

name: Fred Williams III
street_address: E. 121st St. and S. Willowbrook Ave.
circumstances: Authorities say deputies were on patrol when they saw a large group of people, including one who was holding a gun. According to detectives, Williams pointed a gun at the pursuing deputy before he was shot.

name: Armando Sabat
circumstances: A man believed to be a transient allegedly fired several shots at California Highway Patrol officers and Caltrans maintenance workers on the Katella off-ramp. He then ducked inside of a tent and refused to come out. Hours later, police shot and killed him.

name: Dana Mitchell Young Jr.
circumstances: Around 4 a.m., a Los Angeles County sheriff's deputy was search for a man was wanted for assault with a deadly weapon. After a brief vehicle pursuit, Dana Young was shot and killed.

name: Kevin Carr
street_address: S Figueroa St. and W. 111th St.
circumstances: An allegedly armed man approached four people in a parking lot, and officers on patrol saw the situation and stopped and reportedly ordered Kevin Carr to disarm, and then shot and killed him.

name: Steven Vest
street_address: 2005 Dr Martin Luther King Jr Pkwy
circumstances: A man who reportedly brandished a knife and threatened people was shot and killed by Chico Police Department officers responding to the call.

name: Jose Marcos Ramirez
circumstances: Bakersfield police shot and killed a man they say was armed with a knife and had just stabbed his mother.

name: Cesar Vargas
circumstances: About 11:30 p.m. officers responded to an attempted carjacking with a knife in the area of Market Street and Gough Street. Officers located and pursued the suspect to Otis Street, where they attempted to arrest him, and then officers shot and killed him. Details as to what precipitated the killing were withheld by police.
officer_names: Kyle Roach, Nicholas Delgado (both fired weapons)

name: Shayne Allen Sutherland
circumstances: Shayne Sutherland reportedly called 911 from an AM/PM store's phone and claimed to be an employee who was just robbed. Police called the store back and talked to an employee, who said Sutherland was harassing customers and threatening the employee. Officers arrived around 7:10 p.m. and ordered Sutherland to walk outside and sit down. He reportedly admitted to recent drug use. He attempted to flee, but officers tackled and restrained him, and he died.

name: Nick Burgos
circumstances: Two deputies reportedly were guarding a third who was hospitalized at Harbor-UCLA Medical Center when a patient suffering a psychiatric crisis lunged toward one of them while carrying a metal medical device, and the deputy shot and killed Nick Burgos, who died days later.

name: Juan Adrian Garcia
circumstances: A deputy shot and killed Juan Adrian Garcia during a traffic stop around 10 p.m. when he allegedly exited his vehicle with one hand tucked behind his back and began walking toward the deputy.

name: Christopher Ulmer
circumstances: Following a chaotic, 100-mile pursuit at high speeds, police shot and killed a man. Officers fired at least 10 rounds before siccing a police dog on the man. Police withheld details as to whether the man was armed or what precipitated the killing.

name: Austin Manzano
street_address: W. Calle La Sombra and Bradford St.
circumstances: Manzano called 911 at 1:10 a.m. and told dispatchers he was armed with a loaded handgun and would begin shooting people unless police responded. Deputies Robert Medina and Greg Tougas saw Manzano holding a large knife in his left hand and what was later discovered to be a replica handgun in his right hand. The deputies ordered Manzano to drop the weapons, but Manzano refused and approached the two deputies. Deputies shot Manzano within two minutes of arriving, and he died two weeks later.

name: Mickel Erich Lewis Sr.
circumstances: A deputy stopped a driver and had a brief conversation with them before returning to his patrol vehicle. During this time, the driver fled on foot a short distance before he reportedly returned to his vehicle and reached inside. The driver then allegedly charged at the deputy, and the deputy shot and killed him.

name: Jason Rodriguez
street_address: E. Townsend Avenue and S. Helm Avenue
circumstances: Police were called for the report of a family disturbance around 7 a.m.One of the men involved was reportedly armed with a knife. When officers pulled up, they say the man, armed with a kitchen knife was in an argument with his younger brother in the front yard. The younger brother tried to tackle him but was stabbed in the chest. The man with the knife ran, and the officer followed. Other officers used beanbag guns and a Taser which did not incapacitate the man. The officer shot and killed the man when he allegedly lunged at him, killing him.

name: Name withheld by police
circumstances: At 11:18 p.m., deputies stopped a four-door silver sedan. The driver failed to stop, and the deputy pursued until the vehicle became disabled, and all five occupants got out of the vehicle as it was still moving. One of the occupants, a Hispanic male, was reportedly armed with a handgun, and a deputy shot and killed him.

name: Eloy Mares Gonzalez Jr
circumstances: Deputies responded around 4:57 a.m. for reports of a silent burglary alarm. When they arrived, deputies contacted a man in his 40s who was armed with a hatchet outside of the business. Deputies shot and killed the man as they tried to take him into custody. Two of the deputies were reportedly hurt.
officer_names: Chad Lewis (fired weapon), Brandon Silva (fired weapon)

name: Randy Fedorchuk
circumstances: A city staffer encountered the armed man outside La Quinta City Hall around 1:30 p.m. He went inside, and triggered the city's active shooter protocols. Within minutes, police shot and killed the man.

name: Christopher Michael Straub
agency_responsible: San Luis Obispo County Sheriff's Office
circumstances: Deputies conducted a traffic stop on a wanted man. Upon pulling over, the man fled from his vehicle on foot, and two deputies chased him. The suspect ran through vineyards to the Templeton Cemetery and exchanged gunfire with the deputies, wounding one. He attempted to return to his vehicle through the vineyard. Additional deputies arrived and intercepted him as he tried to regain access to his vehicle, and deputies shot and killed him.

name: Kurt Andras Reinhold
street_address: El Camino Real and Avenida San Gabriel
